gov.nasa.ial.mde.describer
Class Describer

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.ial.mde.describer.Describer

public class Describer
extends Object

Describer works with a MDE Solver object to create natural-language text descriptions of graphs. Describer provides methods for setting different description modes and for specifying the output format.

Describer supports two default description modes - VISUAL or MATH. The VISUAL mode provides qualitative descriptions without much mathematical jargon. The MATH mode provides a description of the mathematical solution.

Describer also lets you define new description modes by specifying a new mode name and an XSLT file for transforming the MDE (XML) solution to a textual description.

Two output formats are available for textual descriptions - TEXT_OUTPUT or HTML_OUTPUT. Select the HTML format if you will be displaying MDE descriptions to a browser or other display component that supports HTML.

Describer uses a MdeSettings object to get and set description mode changes.

Math Description Engine Programmers Guide

Version:
1.0
Author:
Dat Truong, Terry Hodgson

Constructor Detail

Describer

public Describer(Solver solver)
Construct a Describer object with the given Solver object. An instance of MdeSettings will be created internally. Use default XSLT template files.

Parameters:
solver - the solver to use with this desriber.

Describer

public Describer(Solver solver,
                 MdeSettings settings)
Construct a Describer object with the given Solver object and MdeSettings object. Use default XSLT template files.

Parameters:
solver - the solver to use with this desriber.
settings - the MDE settings.

public void setOutputFormat(String outputFormat)
Change the output format to the requested type for each description mode transformer.

Parameters:
outputFormat - the desired output format - text or html

addDescriptionMode

public void addDescriptionMode(String modeName,
                               String xslFilename)
Not yet supported. Lets you specify your own text description mode with corresponding XSLT description templates file.

Parameters:
modeName - either "visual" or "math".
xslFilename - the name of the XSL file.

getWordsPerLine

public int getWordsPerLine()
Return the number of words per line for TEXT descriptions. The default value is 15 words per line.

Returns:
the words per line in text description outputs.

setWordsPerLine

public void setWordsPerLine(int wordsPerLine)
Set the number of words per line for TEXT descriptions. The default value is 15 words per line.

Parameters:
wordsPerLine - the wordsPerLine to set for text output
